La historia avanza tras los sucesos vividos en el 2, con nuevos elementos pero sobre la misma base. No quer√≠a m√°s, por tanto aunque continuista cumple sobradamente. La historia funciona bien y est√° bien narrada. Digna continuaci√≥n que tal vez sepa a poco al ser algo corta. (7/10).

I once heard HL2: Episode 1 described as; [i]"The worst parts of Half-Life 2 stretched out into 3 hours."[/i]
After having played I don't agree with that statement.[list]
[*]Some puzzle designs/combat encounters take more risks than those in the base game. Interesting and engaging. Not really a 'repeat' of HL2's moments.
[*]You get Alyx as a companion through most of it, unlike with the base HL2.
[*]Continuing HL2's story introduced some cool world building moments.
[*]Also there's like 2 or 3 new enemies.
wow this was actually horrible, shadowcon was right
More of half-life. Gets boring if you played the original half-life before.
una extension cortita (3 horas ) pero entretenida.. por si quedaste con mas ganas de HL 2...

I have heard so much hate about this game. However, when I sat down and beat it in one sitting. I was satisfied, this game and Episode 2 focus on being an epilogue to the excellent Half Life 2. This game uses old locations from the previous game while adding new twists and new enemies like the new Combine zombie, 'Combie'. As well Alex will accompany you through this 3 1/2 hour experience. It tells a satisfying story which ends in an interesting and compelling cliffhanger which would be fulfilled in the excellent Half Life 2: Episode 2. This game is great and is worth every penny.

Crowbar maniac and his tomboy girlfriend escape an exploding city while the G-Man gets molested by a bunch of aliens.

Well, is not much of an expansion but you get some cute moments with Alyx and more HL2 action. I'll still recommend it, but having a companion pretty much the entire time and being separated from the crowbar for that long doesn't feel right. It's a short game anyways so yes, get it if you liked HL2.
A short sequel to a great game. Enough said.
So, you played Half-Life 2, you've officially ascended beyond the primitive gamer. Now go, and continue to grow in the ways of the crowbar.

O jogo inicia exatamente no encerramento de Half-life 2, mostrando a fuga de Gordon e Alyx do complexo, por√©m diferentemente dos jogos anteriores em Episode One a a√ß√£o √© cooperativa com voc√™ controlando Gordon e Alyx sendo controlada pela IA do jogo. Apesar disso causar uma mudan√ßa dr√°stica em termos de a√ß√£o (durante os combates, voc√™ ter√° uma companheira √∫til e eficiente ao seu lado), o jogo consegue ser t√£o bom quanto o original tanto em termos de hist√≥ria como entretenimento.
Resumindo, seu √∫nico defeito √© n√£o possuir um final propriamente dito assim como o anterior (h√° uma brecha para o pr√≥ximo jogo), mas definitivamente √© um excelente jogo, portanto eu o recomendo.

Way too short for a dlc. It continues the story right after the ending of the 2nd game but doesn't add anything to the formula. My first playthrough took less than 2 hours. Has all the same problems i had with the 2nd game. Not worth 8 dollars.

Worst of the series. But half-life!

Half Life 2 ep. 1
an episodic "expansion" of the half life francise, particularly half life 2 branch working and looking quite simular to Half Life 2, running on the same engine, and immediately continuing the story after the events of Half Life 2 ending.

First of all I want to say in my opinion, if you had any type of intrest in half life 2 story or if youve played half life 2 and liked it, you should definitely play the episodic contant.
Both of them are short one being from 3 to 2.5 hours and the other lasting from 5 to 4.4 hours, all together coming at 8 to 7 hours of solid playthrough, each one can be finish in one sitting!..
So if you are buying one of them I strongly suggest you to buy them both, they worth the money in my opinion but theres always a weird animal called a "sale", its very common in the land of "steam" if you might noticed.

Now, for an actual review of specifically episode 1.
For all I can tell on story is that its putting you in the shoes of gordon freeman again and youll be teaming up with alex to the rest of the game, I do not wish to spoil much for thats all I allow myself to tell.
Half Life episode 1 is much more focused on story and worldbuilding then half life 2, I would actually compare it to the level of story telling in the end of blue shift if youve played that.. 

What I can tell is thats the story is pretty charming indeed and expands a lot on the half life 2 univeres while fallowing along with gameplay.

The gameplay, in particularly level design is solid with banch of puzzles, combat twicks, and great shooting sections, others not as much great but take it with a grain of salt since shooting in half life isnt quite good from the bones, the reason why its fun is because of the level design and the well done timing twicks of the combat.
And indeed some weapons and enemies where twicked from half life 2, some for the better and other are a little bit unnecessary but all around a pleasant change, especially the shotgun-extremely satisfying.
Also there being added new enemies and new useful prop that may shine a light through the darkness, which isnt absence in this game either.

There are a bit of stuff in here that will be concider rushed, like a "glitch" where alex need to get down from a train while you and her need to get through a hole in a wall.
But the only problem is that after you got through that hole there is a loading screen and after that loading screen if alex didnt came out of the train Before youd pass through the hole she would just be stuck on the train, and dont think you can go back there and load her again because the "going back" loading screen is actually unreachable so or you try to find it on the train by nocliping or its just non existant, Im not sure, either case youre stuck, the switch to open the next door in that room can only be hacked by alex so or you load an older save or you noclip and try to find the loading screen back or forward for alex to spawn if that would work...
Just funny stuff like this are still around a game as old as this.
There are not a lot of "bugs'' like this even tho it aint a bug but just a game design obious flaw that can be easily fixed, except I guess the strider that is now lets say... more of a hit scanner that he'd ever being in a broken way..
just a note a head Those are the small and most noticeable uglys in this episode, the rest are quite rear and not a problem.

With a small amout of new features, new levels and an important proggression through the story of half life 2, episode 1 is short but it definitely feels shorter... Just dont forget if you play it, YOU WILL play the second episode.
solid 7/10, ";you smell that, its freedom -you never know;".

I really like the director's commentary feature (This is my first time experiencing HL2 commentary track, I haven't played Lost Coast at this point): quite an insight on the process of the narrative design and level design and how these interlinked with each other efficiently to sustain the players' immersion. Some of the behind the scenes stuff might surprise you on how they pull the strings to make the images in the game to work without breaking it. The developers also mentioned all sorts of unused and cut ideas, and how playtesters reacted to those, so that's kinda neat. 

Eh, gameplay's fun and stuff, very replayable, speedrun-able. The puzzle's fine.
You prolly wanna play this game three times for: 
-First run
-Second time for achievement hunting
-Third time for the commentary track

If you want a straight forward sci-fi action FPS game, this is one of the better ones.
Perfect game--possibly even better than Half-Life 2 main. Great pacing and fun challenges. This time, the rocket-launcher sequences aren't so unforgiving or insanely difficult.
I was so rooting for Alyx and Gordon the entire time and couldn't stop...

Pros:
-Graphical improvements, facial animations slightly improved (although characters don't really keep the same emotions when moving)
-Alyx actually interacts with you more by joking around
-One new Zombie type is introduced: the Zombine

Cons:
-Much shorter than Half-Life 2
-Same amount of "interactive" cutscenes
-Only one new enemy
-Second and final acts get tedious and feel about the same as the rebellion section in the previous game
-Final act (escort mission) is quite boring and sometimes frustrating
-Silent protagonist approach still doesn't work

I'd only recommend this for the sake of continuing the story.

Please for the love of god, do not play this game, do not let yourself fall into the endless loop of sorrow. After you play it, you will like it, you will love it, you will ask for more, you will play Episode 2, and you will cry,  you will ask for another sequel, you will go Youtube and watch what Lord Gaben has promised us, you will wait, you will start to hate Valve, you will start to hate Lord Gaben himself, you will live your whole live in depression, you will drink a lot of alcohol, you will take a lot of hard drug to numb yourself, you will get ill, you will die.

If you don't want to die, please don't play this game.
I love all episodes of this game, i never get bored by playing this.
